answers.answer: Lack of urine usually means he's dehydrated, which would also explain the shakiness.  With diabetes there is an increase in urine as the body tries to rid itself of the sugar.  Shakiness normally comes with low blood sugar.  I would get him checked out, because something is obviously wrong, and it may be serious. This is confusing, I wouldn't take any chances.  Has he been sick to where he was vomiting and/or diarrhea?  If so he may have become dehydrated and has not gotten rehydrated.  He need things like Pedialyte, bananas, orange juice.  But if it's sever he need IV rehydration. It can be difficult to recover from dehydration, and this is why IV is the best way to go.  Good luck with this and take care.
